text:
TIL:

```julia> for i in 1:2
           @time ((t, s) -> @. t + 1 * s + t^5)([1], [3]);
       end
  0.060273 seconds (203.24 k allocations: 9.493 MiB)
  0.000005 seconds (7 allocations: 448 bytes)```
Julia knows that the two loops are the same and so it keeps track of that anonymous function created the first time.

elements.text: Julia knows that the two loops are the same and so it keeps track of that anonymous function created the first time.

text: Anonymous funtions are (always) compiled only once for certain input types, just like normal functions. There are some docs about it here <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/devdocs/functions/#Closures>
